threat: Mariusz Mlynski and others discovered several flaws in Firefox that allowed  a remote attacker to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted  page, a remote attacker could exploit this to bypass security protections  and perform cross-origin reading of the Location object.
